form.label: Pods
form.description: A pod (as in a pod of whales or pea pod) is a group of one or more containers (such as Docker containers), with shared storage/network, and a specification for how to run the containers. A pod’s contents are always co-located and co-scheduled, and run in a shared context. A pod models an application-specific “logical host” - it contains one or more application containers which are relatively tightly coupled — in a pre-container world, they would have executed on the same physical or virtual machine. -- source: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod/

search.query: `k8smeta` sourcetype::kube:objects:pods $namespace$ metadata.labels.name=$podfilter$ | stats values(status.containerStatuses{}.ready) AS ready, values(metadata.namespace) AS namespace, values(status.podIP) AS podIP, values(spec.nodeName) AS node, latest(status.containerStatuses{}.restartCount) AS restarts, values(metadata.creationTimestamp) AS creationTimestamp, values(spec.containers{}.image) AS image by metadata.name | rename metadata.name AS name | sort - creationTimestamp
